description:
Iron Fist’s first appearance! Meet Marvel’s resident Kung Fu hero, the mystical One of K’un-Lun, the Immortal Iron Fist! Mentor Yu-Ti recalls the origin of Daniel Rand, a young boy born far outside the mystic heights of K’un-Lun. Tragedy begets one of Marvel’s mightiest heroes.

In the realm of K'un-Lun, Iron Fist completes a display of his martial-arts skills under the watch of Yu-Ti and the Dragon-Kings. Iron Fist requests that he be able to undergo the 'Challenge of the One'. Before he does so, Yu-Ti requests for Iron Fist to reflect on his past.

Ten years ago, business man Wendell Rand embarked on an expedition to find the mythical city of K'un-Lun accompanied by his wife (Heather Rand), his business partner (Harold Meachum) and his 9 year old son (Daniel Rand, the future Iron Fist).

While searching for K'un-Lun in the Himalayas, which only appears on Earth once every 10 years, an accident befalls the party. While crossing a gorge, Danny slips over the edge of a cliff, pulling his mother behind him. Wendell manages to save the two by lowering them to a nearby ledge, but ends up dangling over the side of the cliff himself. He turns to Meachum for help, but Meachum stamps on his hand, causing Wendell to let go, and thus fall to his death.

Meachum reveals that no-one will be able to prove it, and that he is now the head of Rand-Meachum Inc. He claims that he did it all for the love of Heather, and offers to rescue the two stranded on the ledge, but leaves them there to die when Heather refuses his help.

Returning to the present, Yu-Ti agrees to subject Iron Fist to the Challenge of the One, in which Iron Fist has to fight a being called Shu-Hu. The battle begins and, finding himself outmatched, Iron Fist reflects further on the past.

After Meachum leave Heather and Danny for dead, the pair begin to hike out of the mountains. They soon come across a bridge, but are attacked by a pack of wolves. Heather sacrifices herself to the wolves to allow Danny to cross the bridge, which leads him K'un-Lun. We then return to the present, where Iron Fist still battles on.

Spurned onward by his memories, Danny channels the power of the Iron Fist, punching and destroying Shu-Hu, who is revealed to be a robot. Having completed the challenge, Yu-Ti offers Iron Fist the choice of immortality, or death.
name: The Fury of Iron Fist!

description: The demented duo of Garth Ennis (PUNISHER) and John McCrea (Hitman) unleash the green goliath!  Meet Patrick D. Mitchell. His father was awarded the Silver Star for his service in Viet Nam. His grandfather died during General Patton's drive to the Rhine during WWII. It's even rumored that one of his relatives charged up San Juan Hill with Teddy Roosevelt. Today it's Patrick's turn to face his destiny. For today his Company in the U.S. Army's 29th Infantry will lock and load, say their prayers, and face down the living engine of destruction known as the Hulk. And in the blazing heat of the Nevada desert, Mitchell will feel the cool grip of Death around his throat... and the breath of the strongest creature to ever walk the Earth on his neck. Patrick D. Mitchell is a Lieutenant. But today he just may learn what it means to be a soldier.
name: Part One

description: Garth Ennis unleashes the Hulk! What hope do mere mortal men have against the most powerful creature to ever walk the planet? Learn the answer as Ennis and John McCrea (Jenny Sparks) look into the minds of the soldiers given the unlucky order of facing the green goliath!
name: Part Two

description: World War II is the setting for an atmospheric miniseries starring heroes very much like Batman, Superman and the Golden Age Justice Society of America. In 1942, as war rages around the globe, a vicious albino smuggler intercepts a parcel intended for the Axis powers, a parcel whose contents could change the outcome of the war. The always grinning ne'er-do-well plans to sell the item to the highest bidder, but the Allies have other plans, and send their top covert agents to claim the mysterious package. Now "Owl," "Clock," "Bat" and a host of other very familiar costumed characters battle for the safety of an Elseworld in JSA: THE LIBERTY FILES, a 2-issue Prestige miniseries by the Doctor Strange: Servant of Bones team of co-writer Dan Jolley and co-writers/artists Tony Harris and Ray Snyder. In addition to interior pencils, Harris also provides stirring painted covers for both issues of THE LIBERTY FILES, and even STARMAN readers familiar with his intepretations of classic Golden Age characters will be surprised at how well he integrates the JSA, Batman, Robin, and others into unexpected settings, facing Egyptian thugs, Nazi troops and undead assassins, among them a deadly monster known as the Scarecrow. As the fate of the world hangs in the balance, heroes change allegiances, fall prey to horrible fates, and stand together in the face of a threat no one could have anticipated: an alien super-man who serves the Nazi cause.
name: Brother Can You Spare a Mind?

description: The stylish World War II adventure concludes. The Bat and the Clock, now in possession of the Nazi communique that confirms the existence of a Nazi "super-man," head to Switzerland, where they are to rendezvous with a former field agent named Terry Sloane, nicknamed "Mister Terrific." But before they can meet with him, they encounter the Scarecrow, a terrifying undead Nazi "cleaner." Surprising revelations abound as our intrepid heroes follow a twisted trail from the Führer's Bavarian estate to the steaming plains of Africa, where they go up against Hitler and his troops in an unforgettably explosive battle.
name: And the Clock Struck Midnight

description: This issue contains a prelude to Alley Cat
name: Dragon Blade, Part 3

description:
Overview

Two of comics most beloved and quirky superheroes, Mike Allred's Madman and Bernie Mireaults's The Jammer, meet up for the first time. Frank Einstein visits Gordie's fair city, and when weird stuff starts to go down, it isn't long before they realize they are the only two crimefighters in town. Drawn into a bizarre house of optical illusions, the pair must battle against giant insects, spiraling staircases, and disorientation of every kind.
name: House of Escher

description:
Overview

Comics' two strangest heroes have their strangest adventure yet! Trapped in the surreal home of M.C. Escher, they must find their way to the end of the maze and free the maiden! But where is the end and where is the beginning? Up and down, front and back, sense and nonsense all change places, thanks to the infernal meddling of those darn kids, Mike Allred and Bernie Mireault!
name: House of Escher II

description: Reprints Ghost Rider #68-69.
name: The Curse of Jonathan Blaze / Personal Demons

volume.name: The Original Ghost Rider Rides Again
The Original Ghost Rider Rides Again

description:
A young man has left Tokyo for Istanbul to meet his mother and find his long-lost father. But instead, he finds that he's fallen headlong into somebody else's rebellion!

Jiro Manabe hasn't seen his parents since he was a child. He doesn't know what to expect, except that his mother is Turkish and his Japanese father mysteriously disappeared when he was almost too young to remember. When a stranger appears who can take Jiro to his mother, the mysteries that Jiro has come to solve only grow deeper. Is a drug-addled belly dancer Jiro's mother? Why and where did Jiro's father go? And perhaps most importantly, why are army troops trying to gun them down?

When Jiro Manabe went to Turkey to find his family, he never thought that he'd wind up in the middle of somebody else's rebellion!

Kasim and his crew of reluctant rebels have slammed through the Turkish army roadblock on the Bosporus Bridge, and Jiro wakes up in the back of the truck, in a poor village somewhere in the Turkish interior. Lira, the motorcyclist who saved Jiro the night before, decides that it's a good chance to escape from these Kurdish guerillas. The mysterious Kasim, however, has different plans. But Jiro can't leave anyway -- the woman with Kasim may be his mother!

The changes are coming fast and furious for Jiro Manabe. He has followed Kurdish rebels along the mean streets of Istanbul, through army blockades and desert villages, all the way to Kurdistan, to the fortress of the Kurdish Aga. Unfortunately, even the Aga himself can only offer Jiro cryptic messages. Tiring of lies and half-truths, it is all Jiro can do to contain the full might of his fury, and when he does let go, there is no doubt among the rebels that Jiro is the Rebel Sword of their prophecies.

Their escape attempt thwarted by a well-aimed cannon burst, Jiro and Lira are captured by Ruken and his henchmen. When a knife is thrown down at his feet, Jiro has no other choice than to clash steel with the hot-headed Kurd! Now, if only he could find out why Ruken has it in for him!

As if dealing with their own infighting isn't enough, the Kurdish rebels have to face down a ruthless bombardment by a Turkish gunship! When the smoke clears, Ruken and his henchmen are gone, and it's time for Jiro to decide whether he should return home... or become a Rebel Sword!

Jiro follows Demirel into the ancient Kurdish city of Irbil. It is here that he hopes to discover his lost parents' whereabouts when the Kurdish Liberation Front's High Council meets! But Ruken and his henchmen appear on the scene with plans to assassinate Jiro and clear the way for Ruken to become the leader of the Kurdish rebels!

Sent to Hell by the Fiend, The Dragon and the costumed adventurer Spawn squabble amongst themselves and do battle with The Fiend herself. Meanwhile, Rapture considers having an abortion, Dale Fisher dumps Alex Wilde, and a recovering Phil Dirt reveals to Howard Niseman that he has AIDS. In Hell, the Fiend sends Spawn to Earth, and sics Overlord on the Dragon.

The Dragon easily defeats Overlord and discovers that The Fiend is in fact Arnold Dimple, the man who shot Debbie Harris. Bonnie Harris manages to separate from The Fiend as a result, and The Devil appears to take her soul. The Devil is confronted and defeated by God, who sends Harris to eternal damnation and Dragon to Earth.

Savage Dragon's in Hell, and he's figured out why! Luckily, he's got somebody in his corner... long beard, nice voice, class act all the way.
name: God Vs. The Devil

description: After battling the Martian forces on Earth and on Mars, Dragon becomes the victim of a sneak attack by Vicious Circle agents Chaos and Control, who manage to beat him senseless, leaving him lying at the feet of Cyberface and the rest of the Vicious Circle.

After establishing the basic organizational, administrative, and training aspects of S.O.S. over several months, the team is sent on their first mission - to investigate sections of American land that are being replaced by portions of "Darkworld," a war-ravaged planet ruled by the villainous Darklord.
Dragon and Smasher join forces with Super-Tough who, along with his arch-enemy Darklord, were perhaps sent to a parallel Earth after the explosion of the nega-bomb that burned Mace's face.
Dragon, Smasher, and Darkworld's version of Debbie Harris manage to escape the planet in a Martian saucer before it explodes.
After months of traveling, Dragon and his companions return to where Earth should be, but instead land on a planet inhabited by various pantheons of 'Gods.'

As She-Dragon successfully ends a Vicious Circle crime wave, Chris Robinson is dumped by Alex Wilde when he learns that he was Star. The battle between Dragon, Smasher, Thor, Herakles, and several other creatures is ended by Allgod, a near-omnipotent manifestation of the planet's 'Elder Gods.'
After Star is revealed to be just Kill-Cat in disguise, several S.O.S. members travel to Lieberheim on a mission to oust that nation's ruthless dictator, DreadKnight.
Dragon returns to Chicago and sleeps with Alex Wilde, although they remain 'friends.' Soon afterwards, he breaks up a battle between Mace/She-Dragon and Octopus/Cyberface/Powerhouse.

Super-Tough and Mace are re-united, and it is revealed that the two were lovers. Soon afterwards, an Atlantean army leads a very unsuccessful invasion of the Earth's surface. Cyberface (in BrainiApe's body AND in Overlord's armour) and his allies battle several Vicious Circle agents, a fight that is interrupted by both Dragon and the new Deadly Duo: Kill-Cat and Beast Boy. Before Dragon can defeat Cyberface, they are held at gunpoint by Hitler's brain.

Hitler's brain is able to kill Cyberface and reclaim the BrainiApe body, after which Dragon and Cyberface's team attack Horde and the Vicious Circle, and are soon joined by S.O.S., Mighty Man, and members of the Chicago Police Department!
name: Critter Crime Wave; Wicked Worm's Circus of Evil; Basic Training; Mighty Man Battles The Conqueror Worm

description:
Overview

Strap yourself in -- the first release from the most anticipated new line in comics, GORILLA COMICS, is here! Kurt Busiek (Astro City, Avengers, Marvels), Stuart Immonen (Superman, Final Night, Legion of Super-Heroes) and Wade Von Grawbadger (Teen Titans, Starman) join forces to bring you the FIRST GUARANTEED HIT OF THE NEW MILLENNIUM: SHOCKROCKETS! A 6-Issue Monthly Limited Series! The time: Late in the next century. The place: A damaged, battered Earth, struggling to rebuild after a devastating alien invasion. The stars: The Shockrockets, an elite quadron of specialized aircraft - a hybrid of human and alien technology that repulsed the alien invasion and now guards Earth against threats from all quarters. To Alejandro Cruz, a young, machine-mad, blue-collar Los Angeleno, the Shockrockets pilots are Earth's favored few -- the masters of their destiny, who make the world tick instead of enduring shortages and hardship. But when, in a fluke, Cruz becomes a Shockrocket pilot himself, he learns what it's like from the other side -- the pressure, the responsibility, and the power of being a major player on a global stage, including dealing with some very nasty enemies. Cruz is in for the ride of his life, but he'll have to learn fast -- both in the cockpit and out -- if he's going to survive! SHOCKROCKETS will feature all the humanity, drama and thrilling adventure that fans have come to expect from Busiek and Immonen. "Our aim is to make you smell the jet fuel and feel the sonic booms," says Kurt. "To step right into Alejandro's life, and his world." Plus: An all-new exclusive prologue story to next month's Gorilla launch: EMPIRE, by Mark Waid (JLA, Kingdom Come) and Barry Kitson (JLA Year One, Brave And The Bold)! SHOCKROCKETS! On time and in your paws in April! The FIRST from GORILLA...and only from IMAGE.
name: We Have Ignition!

description:
Overview

"Command Decision" The Shockrockets are Earth's last line of defense against everything from alien invasion to devastating earthquakes. So what happens when a rookie joins their ranks? Alejandro Cruz is the newest Shockrocket pilot, due to a fluke of fate -- but is he up to the job? He's untrained and inexperienced -- and the world has to depend on the Shockrocket squadron for their very survival. Can they take a chance on Alejandro, no matter what the circumstances? Can they afford to? "Command Decision" focuses on whether Alejandro will remain in the squadron, or whether he'll wash out. And in the high-pressure world of the Shockrockets, that could very well be a life-or-death decision... Plus: A crucial mission, a look at the Shockrockets' backers, and a hint or two about developing mysteries. The twists and turns are just starting -- don't miss out!
name: Command Decision!

description:
Overview                                  

"The Triangle Trade" Is one of the Shockrocket pilots a traitor? The Shockrockets tackle two missions this time -- one against monsters threatening a human outpost, and one, more sinister, against black marketeers trafficking in alien technology. It's an alliance between human criminals, alien refugees, and the inhuman creatures that live beneath the crust of the Earth -- and someone's got to stop it at its source. But one of the Shockrocket pilots may be working with the black marketeers -- and if that's the case, it could spell disaster for all of them. "The Triangle Trade" provides a look at the dark underbelly of the world of Shockrockets -- while providing new insight into the characters of the pilots and the intrigue that surrounds them. And at the speed they fly, there's no room for false moves!
name: The Triangle Trade

description:
Overview                     

Special Engineering Issue -- no, really! Amid mounting tension and worldwide danger, we focus on how the Shockrockets work, as Alejandro delves into the deepest recesses of Shockrockets base, learns the origin of the Shockrockets themselves and discovers a technological breakthrough that will have drastic and permanent repercussions for the entire Shockrockets program. Plus: Alejandro's family visits the base, more on the traitor in the Shockrockets' midst, and the Shockrockets put on an aerial exhibition that finds them giving aid of a sort they never expected. For regular readers, "Rocket Science" will pump up the intrigue and suspense, give them a look at how it all began, and build inexorably toward the final confrontation -- while for new readers, it's an ideal introduction to the team and how they work. And as with all Gorilla Comics, it's completely " New Reader Friendly ".
name: Rocket Science!

description:
Overview

The Shockrockets have protected the world for years -- but now they face treachery from within, and may not even be able to save themselves. Their enemies strike at the heart of Shockrocket Base itself, crippling the squad at a time they're desperately needed to stave off a global threat. Can the Shockrockets survive "Base Treachery"? And even if they can, will it be too late to save the world? Plus: Cruz's breakthrough in understanding how the Shockrockets' alien technology works gives Melina a chance put her demons to rest -- and could provide the key to victory in the face of almost certain destruction. And as always, it's completely New Reader Friendly.
name: Base Treachery!

description:
Overview                         

The explosive finale to the first Shockrockets story arc and the flip book debut of Superstar, the much-anticipated new superhero from Busiek & Immonen! The power-hungry General Korda makes his move -- and no one has a chance of stopping him but the shattered, demoralized Shockrockets squadron. And that's no chance at all -- unless Alejandro Cruz, the newest of the Shockrocket pilots, can succeed where the finest military minds on Earth have failed, and find a way to defeat Korda's super-weapons. It's do or die -- with a world at stake. Also: Enter Superstar! For him, fame is power -- literally. But how far will he go to keep that power? An all-new five-page flip book story. And as always, both stories are New Reader Friendly. Flip covers by Immonen and von Grawbadger.
name: The Darkest Hour!

description: Once upon a time, kids used to dream of running away to join the circus, but now that's out of date. Young Todd Cooper has a new dream for a new millennium: run away and join the Doodah Brothers' Astral Travelling Entertainment and Fun Brigade, travelling from planet to planet with its incredible cast of Greebles, Flurps, Bearded Plankton, and Klone-Klowns, and avoiding the deadly Sky-Pirates!

The insidious Captain Quark, pirate of the airways, has a plan to infiltrate the Doodah Brothers' Astral Travelling Entertainment and Fun Brigade, using it in his grand scheme to plunder the galaxy. So what's likely to stop him? Well, this issue, it sure doesn't look like Todd Cooper, the lost Earth lad who can't even get accepted by the Klone-Klowns of Klarion.

Gather 'round, people ... don't crowd! You say you want a weird, silly funnybook? You say you've had it up to eyebrow level with the super-guys? Well, step right up ... tell ya what we're gonna do! We're gonna sell you the third, bizarre issue of Space Circus, lovingly handcrafted for your dining and dancing pleasure by Eisner winners Sergio Aragones and Mark Evanier. It's the tale of an Earth boy who runs off and joins an interplanetary circus and, of all the issues done so far, this is probably the third one. (Go away, kid ... you bother me ... )

It was -- past-tense -- the greatest show in the galaxy ... but now the Doodah Brothers' Astral Travelling Entertainment and Fun Brigade is in the clutches of Captain Quark and the Space Pirates of Salgari. Young Earthling Todd Cooper is the only thing that just might be able to stop them from plundering the galaxy. (Well, him and Eisner Award winners Sergio Aragonés and Mark Evanier. Let's see if they can actually wrap up this four-issue mini series in the fourth issue!)

Meet the Trinity Angels! When Maria, Teresa and Gianna Barbella awake mysteriously in the woods, they find their entire lives turned upside down. Suddenly scantily clad and endowed with powerful assets, our heroines must battle the villany of Head-Butt and his strange henchmen. Follow the exploits of the Trinity Angels, a titillating send-up of the mid-90's Bad Girl comic craze.
name: Trinity Angels

description:
Enter Prick! The biggest, baddest and spikiest bad-guy around barges his way into the fight with the Angels. Can our heroines discover the secrets of the Trinity Gems in time to avoid the prickly venegance of Prick?!

The Trinity Angels discover more about their powers, defeat some monsters and learn that they are sisters
name: Like The Verb, Not The Noun!

description:
The mystery of the Trinity Angels continues to unfold, as wedding bells sound for Teresa, Gianna discovers she can fly, and the body in the woods is discovered!

The Trinity Angels discover more about their new powers, and how to transform back into their usual forms.
name: Get Me To The Church On Time

description:
Wedding Crashers! There is no greater danger than the Mother of the Bride, especially when Head-Butt and the gang crash the wedding of Teresa and Tony. Who is the Queen, and how will the Angels stop her?!

The Trinity Angels learn how they transformed, and Teresa's wedding is interrupted by Angelina Barbella's transformation into the monster queen
name: Eaten By the Flaming Queen!

description:
The Barbella sisters get new (and easier-to-draw) costumes, the Queen entrusts four of her children with the Black Gem and Harvey agrees to train the Trinity Angels.

The Angels learn the origin of the Trinity gems that power them, and the Queen sends her henchmen to awaken more monsters.
name: Unearthing The Truth

description:
The Trinity Angels take their talents to Las Vegas. After saving a group of people from a burning building, the heroines face off with gambling-addict turned monster, Paul Ziaro, aka the Lounge Lizard.

Losing gambler Paul Ziaro is transformed into Lounge Lizard and takes his revenge on a gangster as the Trinity Angels visit Las Vegas.
name: Song Of The Lounge Lizard

description:
A battle rages in Las Vegas! The Trinity Angels face off against the Lounge Lizard and the Queen's monstrous servitors as they tear through the City of Sin. The question is: will they survive their first real confrontation?

Mokey visits Dr Lee, and the Angels sort matters out in Las Vegas while more monsters join the Queen in New York.
name: Viva Las Vegas!

description:
Whoever said that Hawaii was a great place for vacationing clearly never had to face off with a giant monster crab out at sea. As the Angels face off against this monstrosity, Gianna falls desperately in love with the mystery man from the sea known only as Tintonerrea.

The angels meet naked Aquatic superhero Tintorrera, who falls for Maria as they combat King Crab
name: Carnage Of The Collossal King Crab

description: The Barbella sisters have a new menace to deal with. If the sibling rivalry doesn't tear them apart, the Rumblin' Guys just might!
name: Let's Get Ready to Rumble

description: The Queen of the gremlins begins the ritual to uncork her demon sons! Teresa is fed up and quits! And the Angels get wet with the demented milk of the Mad Cow! If his moo-juice hits New York, it's Mad Cow disease for everyone!
name: Fearful Reunion

description: The eve of destruction is here! The Queen manages to call on all of the 99 at once and the Barbella sisters must call in all the help they can. When the Rumblin' Guys and Ninjak take the field will it be enough to save the day?
name: Eve of Destruction

description: Final issue. The Trinity Angels vs. the Queen! George Barbella explains his actions! Tony gets revenge! Cameos by Quantum & Woody and the Rumblin' Guys! All this and more in the 28-pages.
name: Destroy All Monsters!

description:
A series of chilling tales with addendum introductions of John Ostrander.

An actress sets to focus on a past life in a Hollywood party that leads her to live as Genghis Khan while Genghis Khan reflects on his excesses before both intersect psyches.

A young child forewarns his psychologist that his step-father may be a monster.
name: That's Entertainment; Ghengis Sings!!!; Warning Signals
none
none

description:
Could Wasteland's location be in the DC Universe? Discover an answer in the "Big Crossover Story" with cameos from some unexpected guests! Stories by John Ostrander, Del Close, David Lloyd, William Messner-Loebs and Donald Simpson.
 

Cover to Cover

There was a misprint to copies of issue #5, where the cover for issue #6 is printed instead of the proper cover.  Make Sure that the contents in the Silver Woman cover is really issue #6.
name: This Time We Win!; Under The Lash; Big Crossover Story

description:
Cover to Cover


Because of the printing error on issue #6 where the contents were reprinted of issue #5, Wasteland reissued a new blank cover with a black and white boarder.  This reissue would be titled "The Real No. 6".  The colored cover with a Silver Woman contains the wrong material inside.
name: Method Actor; Paper Hero; On The Road Part 1
On The Road Conclusion; Secret Lords of the DNA!; The St.Louis Electric Giraffe Caper
Heebee Geebeeies; The Dead Detective; "The Eye, like Some Strange Balloon..."
Mother; The Dreamer in the Darkness; Life's Illusion
Embryo; Revenge of the Swamp Creature; Dissecting Mister Fleming
After The Dead Detective; Passing Grade; Titty-Tat Breath
Tipped Toes; Astigmata; Message From The Star Worms

none
The Woman Who Tried To Find God; "All I Want For Christmas Is The Head Of Idi Amin!"; Heartshadow

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning
